page.title: 17KIRKHOLT CLEAN-UP
page.content: On Monday, 22nd. July, all the children in the third year at Thornham Middle School took part in a massive clean-up operation on Kirkholt Estate. The estate was built shortly after the second world war and has lots of open spaces for the residents to enjoy, but some thoughtless people had dumped rubbish in these places, and even a little rubbish is enough to make the area look unsightly. The Groundwork Trust organised the activity and provided skips, wheelbarrows and shovels. The children worked all day, sometimes in the rain, and by the end of the day had collected about six skip-fulls of rubbish. We hope that the improvement will last, and that our actions will make people think before they dump rubbish.
